text: Polybotrya andina is a species of fern in the family Dryopteridaceae. It is native to Ecuador and Peru. Its natural habitats are subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests and subtropical or tropical moist montane forests. It is threatened by habitat loss. ==References== * Navarrete, H. & Pitman, N. 2003. Polybotrya andina. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 23 August 2007. Category:Dryopteridaceae Category:Flora of Ecuador Category:Flora of Peru Category:Vulnerable flora of South America Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Polybotrya andina
